conclusion: Determine the length of the arc where light from point O cannot directly exit through AB or BC.
ABCO is a square with side length R; arc AC has radius R and is centered at O.
Refractive index n of the material is 2.
Critical angle θc for total internal reflection is 30°.
Light emitted from O towards arc AC will refract at the boundary.
If angle of incidence > 30°, total internal reflection occurs, and light will not exit through AB or BC.
Arc AC subtends an angle of 90° at center O.
Angle corresponding to arc where light can exit is 30°.
Angle corresponding to arc where light cannot exit is 60°.
Length of the arc corresponding to 60° is πR/3.
